field.name: Classification
field.definition: an indication as to whether the resource is refereed or non-refereed

terms.termAndDeftn: the resource was subjected to critical evaluation by one or more experts in the field to determine the originality and quality of the research and whether the subject falls within the scope of the publication

the resource was not subjected to critical evaluation by one or more experts in the field to determine the originality and quality of the research and whether the subject falls within the scope of the publication

dos.practice: Books, book chapters, book forewords, book reviews, and technical notes are not refereed.
Presentations and posters are not refereed.
Some proceedings are refereed, but most are not.

To determine if proceedings have been referred, consult the event or sponsor's website. It is generally very clearly stated if and when proceedings have been refereed. If this information is not explicit, the proceedings should be cataloged as non-referreed.

examples.practice: Refereed: papers cataloged in the AMS publications collection.
Refereed: papers cataloged in the virtual IMAGe collection contained within OSGC.
